column4: as wulfy I'm in charge of virtualization: openvz is a very good choice for linux only, ESX is not bad vmware server as memory leaks under linux, and for Xen and KVM I'm just testing
i really like xen seems to get the job done least amount of fuss combine with the solusvm control panel and your good to go, a lot of cleints like it
I'm more into KVM for the moment, cause the patches are already integrated in the kernel and my server OS is Centos
our node os is centos and thkernel updates are prity fast and on the ball
